SENT.plain: A 4-year-old Japanese girl with systemic juvenile rheumatoid arthritis had an attack of measles
On the day following the first signs of measles she became afebrile and free of joint pain even though aspirin therapy was discontinued
It appears that the measles virus infection may have been responsible for the brief remission in this patient
The observation of a remission of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis after measles is extremely rare
